class pynav.types.State(value: Any, dof: int, stamp: Optional[float] = None, state_id=None)Â¶

Bases: abc.ABC

An abstract state \(\mathbf{x}\) is an object containing the following attributes:

  • a value of some sort;

  • a certain number of degrees of freedom (dof);

  • an update rule that modified the state value given an update vector dx containing dof elements.

Optionally, it is often useful to assign a timestamp (stamp) and a label (state_id) to differentiate state instances from others.

valueÂ¶

State value

Type

Any

dofÂ¶

Degree of freedom of the state

Type

int

stampÂ¶

Timestamp

Type

float

state_idÂ¶

Some identifier associated with the state

Type

Any

abstract plus(dx: numpy.ndarray)Â¶

A generic âadditionâ operation given a dx numpy array with as many elements as the dof of this state.

abstract minus(x: pynav.types.State) → numpy.ndarrayÂ¶

A generic âsubtractionâ operation given another State object of the same type, always returning a numpy array.

abstract copy() → pynav.types.StateÂ¶

Returns a copy of this State instance.

jacobian(x: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarrayÂ¶

Jacobian of the plus operator. For Lie groups, this is known as the group Jacobian.

class pynav.types.MeasurementModelÂ¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract measurement model base class, used to implement measurement models of the form

\[\mathbf{y} = \mathbf{g}(\mathbf{x}) + \mathbf{v}\]

where \(\mathbf{v} \sim \mathcal{N}(\mathbf{0}, \mathbf{R})\).

abstract evaluate(x: pynav.types.State) → numpy.ndarrayÂ¶

Evaluates the measurement model \(\mathbf{g}(\mathbf{x})\).

abstract jacobian(x: pynav.types.State) → numpy.ndarrayÂ¶

Evaluates the measurement model Jacobian \(\mathbf{G} = \partial \mathbf{g}(\mathbf{x})/ \partial \mathbf{x}\).

abstract covariance(x: pynav.types.State) → numpy.ndarrayÂ¶

Returns the covariance \(\mathbf{R}\) associated with additive Gaussian noise.

jacobian_fd(x: pynav.types.State)Â¶

Calculates the model jacobian with finite difference.

class pynav.types.ProcessModelÂ¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract process model base class for process models of the form

\[\mathbf{x}_k = \mathbf{f}(\mathbf{x}_{k-1}, \mathbf{u}_{k-1}, \Delta t) + \mathbf{w}_{k-1}\]

where \(\mathbf{u}_{k-1}\) is the input and \(\Delta t\) is the time period between the two states.

abstract evaluate(x: pynav.types.State, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, dt: float) → pynav.types.StateÂ¶
abstract jacobian(x: pynav.types.State, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, dt: float) → numpy.ndarrayÂ¶
abstract covariance(x: pynav.types.State, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, dt: float) → numpy.ndarrayÂ¶
jacobian_fd(x: pynav.types.State, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, dt: float) → numpy.ndarrayÂ¶

Calculates the model jacobian with finite difference.
